alert.note: Alert for Eastern Alachua; Southern Columbia; Union; Western Alachua (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 05 at 4:11PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Alachua, southwestern Union and southeastern Columbia Counties through 445 PM EDT... At 411 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Upland Pines, or near Worthington Spring, moving northwest at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and minor flooding due to heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor flooding due to heavy rainfall is possible. Locations impacted include... Worthington Spring, Fort White, Worthington Springs, Upland Pines, Groves, Providence and Dukes. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Alachua; Southern Columbia; Union; Western Alachua
